comments:
We are using exclipse with 30 projects. For every project we did an export to 
have tha Ant file.

For some unknown reason the build file gives an error. In the Problem windows 
we can read for some projects "0:0 Unidentified parse error". The strange 
thing is that this problem comes and goes. I mean if you delete all projects 
out of the workspace, and again do an import, the problem is gone, for some 
time. After a while the problem is again reported.

This behaviour is seen on different development machines. We don't know how to 
solve this because the generated build.xml file cannot be changed.

This bug does not have enough information in it for me, niether do I know why it
is assigned to me.  Chuck can you have a look.  Otherwise we will close this bug

We have also an ant automatic build implemented which runs out of eclipse. 
This build uses the build.xml files that are exported for every project.

This ant build works fine.

How did you get the build.xml file generated? (it is not a pde build generated
one for sure)
Do you have plug-ins to edit xml files?
Which plug-ins do you have installed?
Please attach a sample of your plug-ins.

Trying to move to ant

The editor you are using is not the Ant editor provided from the Eclipse platform.

The error is not an error that I have seen generated by our Ant integration.
I am suspious, like Pascal, that some other plugin/builder/editor is generating
the error.

Does double clicking on the error provide any more details such as a full stack
trace?

Is any related information available in the log file:
Window>Show View>Other>PDE Runtime>Error Log

The buildfile presented is generated by the export operation provided by the
Eclipse Ant integration.

After some googling I see that you are using the Exadel Studio products
(http://www.exadel.com/products_exadelstudio.htm)?
I am not familiar with these or what type of validation that they do.

Do you experience the problems when not using the Exadel plugins?

Created an attachment (id=29586)
Error Log window


I Added a new screenshot with the content of the ErrorLog window. The warnings
are generated when I open the build.xml file. Could you confirm that this
problem is something of the Exadel plugin.

Yes we are using the Exadel plugins 3.0.4. But I didn't knew the error could 
come from this plug-in. Anyhow I am also in contact with Exacel. They asked me 
to send the build.xml files. I am now waiting for an aswer.

Exadel has version 3.0.5 but this gives the same behaviour.

Dirk, what would really be useful is if you could attach your log file or 
double click on the relevant errors to present the entire stack trace.

This is the log, I cleanded all my projects. I cleared the log file. I do the 
command to start the build

All files are closed in my eclipse.

I double click on the problem build.xml file and the following apears into the 
log file


!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui 2 2 2005-11-09 17:30:33.904
!MESSAGE StructuredTextEditor being used without StructuredDocument

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui 2 2 2005-11-09 17:30:33.904
!MESSAGE          Input Name: build.xml

!ENTRY org.eclipse.wst.sse.ui 2 2 2005-11-09 17:30:33.904
!MESSAGE         Unexpected IDocument implementation: 
org.eclipse.ant.internal.ui.editor.text.PartiallySynchronizedDocument

I do not believe this bug has anything to do with the particular buildfile being
opened.

There is a history of problems with "document" assumptions within the editor
code base of the various components.

Moving to web tools for investigation of the NPE

Hi The stacktrace for the component builder was a known problem in M8 that has
since been fixed in our M9 Integration builds.  This builder is actually gone,
and shouldn't interfere with any build process.

This ia part of a mass update, marking fixed blockers older than 6 months as automatically verified (the logic being it must be fixed or we sure would have heard about it!) As always, feel free to re-open if not fixed!
